lead_paragraph: Ken MacAfee, who played for the Giants in the 1950s, has died. He was 77.MacAfee had what was thought to be a heart attack July 4 while playing golf and was pronounced dead later at a hospital in Brockton, Mass., said Natalie Melo of the Conley Funeral and Cremation Service.MacAfee, an end, played for the Giants from 1954-58, a team spokesman said.His son, Ken, a former Notre Dame star and college football Hall of Famer, also played in the N.F.L.
